{"step_by_step_thinking": "Crescendo angina is a form of angina pectoris that changes or worsens. It occurs at rest or with minimal exertion, usually lasting more than 10 minutes. It is severe and of new-onset within the prior 4-6 weeks. It occurs with a crescendo pattern, meaning it is distinctly more severe, prolonged, or frequent than before. Based on the provided documents, crescendo angina is classified as unstable angina. Therefore, the answer is C. Unstable angina.", "answer_choice": "C"}
